subject: Cybersecurity
title: IoT Security: Billions of Devices, Minimal Protection
description: A short lesson to help you apply IoT Security: Billions of Devices, Minimal Protection.

hook.text: Your smart fridge, baby monitor, and thermostat are connected to the internet. None of them gets security updates.

buildup.text: The Internet of Things adds billions of devices to networks: cameras, sensors, medical devices, and.

discovery.text: Most IoT devices have default passwords, no encryption, and no way to update firmware. They're permanently vulnerable.

twist.text: A casino was hacked through a smart fish tank thermometer connected to the network. Attackers pivoted from the tank.

climax.text: Every IoT device is a potential entry point. The more smart devices you add, the larger your attack surface becomes.

punchline.text: A fish tank thermometer was the backdoor into a casino.

quiz.question: Why are IoT devices a major security concern?
options: Most have default passwords, no encryption, and can't be updated
